text: 25 Grima spasiba a lovely cup of crimean
coffee today it costs about 25 Ukrainian
grivna as the equivalent of $2 50 but
soon it'll become a hundred rubles as
the Russian currency gradually replaces
the Ukrainian one a week ago there was a
sign nailed to this local Parliament
building reading the Parliament of the
autonomous Republic of Crimea written in
Russian but also Ukrainian and Crimean
Tatar now the new letters simply read
the Republic of Crimea State Council
written only in Russian and the Russian
trickle or flying proudly above for now
most crimeans like natasha still have
their Ukrainian passport but as of next
month if they want to keep that but have
to officially declare it to the Russian
Federation and be termed foreigners here
in Crimea otherwise they'll
automatically be issued with a Russian
passport their nationalities officially
changing within a matter of weeks if you
want to watch Ukrainian television now
in Crimea you have to get it via cable
or satellite if you're just watching
analog or terrestrial TV you'll only get
the Russian channels the media here has
already made the shift for now it's the
same time in Crimea as in mainland
Ukraine 20 to 3 here and in Kiev but in
a few weeks time that will zoom forward
by 2 hours as Crimea adopts the Moscow
time zone prepare to adjust your watches
in the new Russian Republic of Crimea
